faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course focuses on how to develop innovative organization and intrapreneurship, whereby the general overview and specific topics are handled. Practical assignments support the acquiring of skills for generation of ideas, teamwork, and business communication, different methods of analysis.
description.et: Kursusel keskendutakse sellele, kuidas kujundada innovaatilist organisatsiooni ja sisemist ettevõtlikkust. (intrapreneruship),Käsitletakse organisatsiooni ja ettevõtlikkust tervikuna ja vastavate eriteemade lõikes. Praktilised ülesanded on suunatud ideede genereerimise arendamisele, erinevate analüüsimeetodite, meeskonnatöö oskuste, ametisuhtlemise, jt oskuste omandamisele.

objectives.en: To give an overview of knowledge and develop skills for creating innovative organization and intrapreneurship (i.e. relevant tools) in order to meet the organizational goals.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade ja kujundada oskusi, kuidas arendada innovaatilist organisatsiooni ja rakendada sisemist ettevõtlikkust (intrapreneruship) ning vastavaid tööriistu organisatsiooni eesmärkide saavutamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en:
Person who has gone through the training: 
- knows what is organizational design and how to develop innovative organization, what are relevant possibilities and possible problems in the process of implementation. 
- is able to analyse organizational practices, apply different methods for studying and directing organization 
- knows the essence and peculiarities of intrapreneurship 
- understands the role of management for intrapreneurship to occur 
- is able to recognize and prevent threats of intrapreneurship 
- is able to analyze the possibilites how to implement intrapreneurship in an organization 
- knows how to increase employees' entrepreneurial attitude 
- is able to use different methods of intrapreneurship implementation 
- knows how to plan and conduct the teamwork

independent_work.et:
During the semester you are graded and the maximum grade is 100 points.
1. Final report: field study, instruction in the folder of SIS and moodle; (maxiumum 50 points).
2. Case study about innovative organization (maximum 15 points).
3. work with text-book (Hatch & Cunliffe) (maximum 10 points).
4. classroom activities (maximum 25 points)

grade_preconditions.et: You should participate in the field study, present the needed materials and be graded for these activities at least 65%.

grade_evaluation.et: Your final grade = 50% comes from semester activities + 50% comes from written assignment: exam work.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. Hatch & Cunliffe (2013). Organization Theory. pp. 90-95; 98-110; 204-214; 269-295; (please borrow from Library at Liivi 4, these are booked for your course). Follow questions when reading. 
2. Timo O. Vuori and Quy N. Huy (2016); Distributed Attention and Shared Emotions in the Innovation Process: How Nokia Lost the Smartphone Battle Administrative Science Quarterly
 Vol 61, Issue 1, pp. 9 - 51 (material for final exam)
3. David Zamora, Juan Carlos Barahona, (2016) "Data-driven innovation at the Grupo Pellas SER company", Emerald Emerging Markets Case Studies, Vol. 6 Issue: 2, pp.1-16, https://doi.org/10.1108/EEMCS-06-2015-0147 (material for moodle based class)
4. Organizational Change: Three Perspectives from John Van Maanen, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fDfgAe9-lpY.

name.en: School of Economics and Business Administration

description.et: Instructor Mervi Raudsaar, Introduction to the course. Introduction to intrapreneurship
Instructor Maaja Vadi, please be prepared (1) the lecture by van Maanen, focus on the three perspectives and be ready to tell about these perspectives;
Instructors Mervi Raudsaar and Maaja Vadi, company meeting at Finnair.
Instructor Mervi Raudsaar, 4 modles of corporate entrepreneurship. The entrepreneurial process.
Instructor Mervi Raudsaar, case study on intrapreneurship. Top-down or bottom-up intrapreneurship.
Instructor Mervi Raudsaar, Design thinking tool for intrapreneursip
Instructor Maaja Vadi, prepare for analysis of Nokia case and be prepared to analyse the case in the three perspective approach by van Maanen.
Instructor Maaja Vadi, prepare the materials from text-book by Hatch and Cunliffe (2013), pp. 90-95, 98-110. SER case, accompanied with analysis national culture (Onion Model by Hofstede).

Instructor Maaja Vadi, company visit (Tallinn),  AS SEB Pank,   innovation centre for businesse See more detailed information about centre:
https://www.seb.ee/eng/news/2018-04-19/altogether-24-ideas-developed-seb-innovation-centre-over-one-year

Instructor Maaja Vadi, focus on the Finnair case study. Be prepared to analyse the case in the three perspective approach by van Maanen.
SER case and Onion model.
Instructor Maaja Vadi, moodle based virtual class, prepare the all the materials from text-book by Hatch and Cunliffe (2013). Be ready perform the essay type on assignments.
Instructors Mervi Raudsaar and Maaja Vadi, presentation of reports
